text: William Arnold Pearl (October 31, 1930 â€“ September 14, 2022) was an American professional bodybuilder and athlete. He won the Mr. Universe contest five times. He was named "World's Best-Built Man of the Century". He later became an expert trainer and wrote about bodybuilding. Pearl died on September 14, 2022 in Phoenix, Oregon from problems caused by Parkinson's disease at the age of 91. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American bodybuilders Category:Writers from Oregon Category:Sportspeople from Oregon
title: Bill Pearl
